menu.commands

Class CloseCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • menu.commands.CloseCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class CloseCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    The CloseCommand class implements the Command interface to close the currently open document.

    Closing the document clears the currently loaded information and the program cannot execute other commands except for opening a file (Open) until a new file is opened. 

     
 Table table = new Table(new TypeChecker());
 CloseCommand closeCommand = new CloseCommand(table);
 closeCommand.execute(new String[] {});
    Since:
    2024-06-24

    • Constructor Detail

      • CloseCommand

        public CloseCommand(Table table)
        Constructs a CloseCommand with the specified Table.
        Parameters:
        table - the table to be closed

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String[] data)
        Closes the currently open file by resetting the file path of the table.

        If the table has a file path set, it is reset to null to indicate the file is closed. A success message is printed to the console. If no file is open, a message indicating that is printed instead.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Parameters:
        data - an array of command parts
